text: Events from the year 1903 in Sweden ==Incumbents== * Monarch – Oscar II * Prime Minister – Erik Gustaf Boström ==Events== * The National Association for Women's Suffrage is founded. * Agnes Arvidsson becomes the first woman to graduate in pharmacology. * Public medical offices open to women."Göteborgs universitetsbibliotek: Akademikeryrken". Ub.gu.se. 2010-11-17. Retrieved 2013-10-07. * Forming of the Central Employers' Association (SAF) ** The SAF game rather late in the labor union movement of Sweden ** Counterpart of the labor union, LO ** Acted as open cartel ==Popular culture== ===Literature=== * August Strindberg's novel Alone () is published. ==Births== * 31 January - Ivar Johansson, wrestler (died 1979). * 21 June - Alf Sjöberg, theatre and film director (died 1980) ===Exact date missing === * Israel Ruong, Swedish- Sámi linguist and politician (died 1986). ==Deaths== Lina Sandell. * 19 May - Carl Snoilsky, poet (born 1841) * 27 July - Lina Sandell, hymn writer (born 1832). * 14 September - Johanna Berglind, sign language teacher and principal (born 1816). * March – Josefina Wettergrund, writer (born 1830) ==References== Category:1903 by country Category:Years of the 20th century in Sweden
title: 1903 in Sweden
